name: General Knowledge 103 Quiz | Mixed 25 Questions | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following pontiffs canonized the most people?
questions.explanation:
Pope John Paul II.

	Pope John Paul II canonized 447 people; now that's a lot of saints.  He died in April 2005.

questions.text: What was the longest recorded flight by a chicken in 2002?
Who was the second American to go into space?
questions.explanation:
Gus Grissom.

	Gus Grissom died in January 1967 when Apollo 1 caught fire on the launch pad at Cape Canaveral.

questions.text: In what year was the first successful transatlantic crossing made in a hot-air balloon?
questions.explanation:
1987.

	Richard Branson and Per Lindstrand took off from Maine USA, landing on the Irish coast in 1987.

questions.text: What was Casanova's real name?
The Thylacine is the scientific name for?
questions.explanation:
Tasmanian Tiger.

	The last confirmed sighting of a live Tasmanian Tiger was in 1936.

questions.text: The abbreviation A.S.I.O. stands for 'Australian ___________ .'
questions.explanation:
Security Intelligence Organisation.

	It is the equivalent of the US Secret Service.

questions.text: About how many different species of rice are there in the world?
According to "Billboard" magazine, who was the most successful musical artist of the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
Mariah Carey.

	I would have thought it was Madonna too!

questions.text: What colour is chablis?
In what US state did the Hindenburg explode?
questions.explanation:
New Jersey.

	It happened at Lakehurst, New Jersey on the 6th of May 1937.

questions.text: What is the largest gulf in the world?
Where does a librocubicularist read?
Who did Squeaky Fromme try to assassinate?
What is the world's southernmost national capital?
What gas did Joseph Priestley discover?
What Italian city is home to da Vinci's 'The Last Supper'?
What is the main ingredient of a bouillabaisse?
In what year did Bobby Riggs challenge Billie Jean King (the then number 1 women's tennis player in the world) to a match?
questions.explanation:
1973.

	Billie Jean King beat him too!

questions.text: Besides the Britannic, what was the Titanic's sister ship called?
What country is the setting for Shakespeare's 'Macbeth'?
questions.explanation:
Scotland.

	'Macbeth' is probably my all-time favorite Shakespeare play.

questions.text: What body part contains the smallest bones?
What does a horologist measure?
How many balls are used in snooker (including the cue ball)?
questions.correct: 22 & twenty-two & twenty two & Twenty-two & Twenty Two
questions.explanation: 22 & twenty-two & twenty two & Twenty-two & Twenty Two.

questions.text: How old was Mary Shelley when she wrote 'Frankenstein'?
